alert.note: Alert for DeSoto (Mississippi) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Memphis (Western Tennessee, Eastern Arkansas and Northern Mississippi)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued August 21 at 12:56PM CDT by NWS Memphis
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 145 PM CDT THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Urban and small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...A portion of North Mississippi, including the following county, DeSoto. * WHEN...Until 145 PM CDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1255 PM CDT, Heavy rainfall has come to an end across DeSoto County, but runoff from earlier thunderstorms will cause urban and small stream flooding. Between 1 and 2 inches of rain have fallen. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Southaven, Olive Branch, Horn Lake, Memphis, Walls, Lynchburg, Plum Point, Jago, Alden, Cedarview, Twin Lakes, Fairhaven, Lake View, Miller and Handy Corner. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
